body:
### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.7.0

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

NA

### Operating system/version

Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS

### Terminal name/version

Kitty 0.15.0/konsole 19.12.3

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

appimage

### How to reproduce the issue

```shell
$ nvim --clean -u minimal.lua
```
```
:edit some_file
```

```lua
-- minimal.lua
-- I didn't see a place to upload the minimal.lua so here ya go
local M = {}

function M:do_thing(origination)
    print("Coming from " .. tostring(origination))
    vim.ui.select({"Yes", "No"} ,{prompt = "Yes No?"}, function(choice) print("choice " .. tostring(choice)) end)
end

do
    if not M.inited then
        vim.api.nvim_command('augroup testing')
        vim.api.nvim_command('autocmd!')
        vim.api.nvim_command('augroup END')
        vim.api.nvim_command('autocmd testing BufReadCmd * :lua require("minimal"):do_thing("bufreadcmd")')
        vim.api.nvim_command('autocmd testing FileReadCmd * :lua require("minimal"):do_thing("filereadcmd")')
        M.inited = true
    end
end

return M
```

### Expected behavior

I have had incredibly inconsistent behavior with `vim.ui.select` so I am not exactly sure _what_ I expect at this point. Given the documentation, I would expect for a sort of selection menu to appear when a file is opened. 
Per the documentation
```
select({items}, {opts}, {on_choice})                         *vim.ui.select()*
                Prompts the user to pick a single item from a collection of
                entries
```


### Actual behavior

I am not quite able to pin down what exactly is happening but it appears as if `vim.ui.select` is doing _something_ as the `choice` function is called immediately. I found this by removing the `tostring(choice)` wrapper on the print line. Doing this will generate a `attempt to concatenate a nil value` error when you try to edit a file of any kind.

Using the `minimal.lua` that is attached, you _can_ require the file and manually run the `do_thing` function (eg, `:lua require("minimal"):do_thing()`) and the select appears. So the select functionality works, it just appears to do weird stuff when its called from an autocommand?

comment_data.body:
Interestingly, replacing `vim.ui.select` with `vim.ui.input` works perfectly fine so I may just opt for using that until someone tells me I'm doing this wrong.

Additional information:
This issue is present in the appimage for `neovim 0.6.0` as well.

title: BufReadCmd/FileReadCmd does not work with vim.ui.select
